intro: Clidemia leucandra var. divaricata, commonly known as silverleaf mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has opposite leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers are borne in clusters and are pollinated by insects, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
